PLACEMENT SERVICE, MAY, 1955i PAGE 11
Extensive staff and management experience in government and academic communications
research and operating organizations. Formerly Director of Radio Workshop and
Audio-Visual Aids Program, major western university. Able to undertake the
development of a new academic division to integrate the arts and sciences involved
in mass communication, offering applied undergraduate and graduate degrees, as
well as a research Ph.D. Presently serving as Executive Assistant, Office of the
Director, major governmental research program at a university.
May 95. ETV and EFM STATION MANAGERS and SPEECH DEPARTMENT CHAIRMEN PLEASE NOTE:
Experienced teacher-producer wants to help you with programming, production, and/or
teaching of radio-television. Ph.D. Presently employed as a university speech-
radio teacher and Director of Radio-TV (includes management of an educational FM
radio station). Experience includes 4 years professional theatre and radio work,
and 5 years teaching and production in educational radio-TV. Complete background
information on request.
May 96. VERSATILE, EXPERIENCED RADIO-TV WORKER. Experienced as Film Director,
Chief Cameraman, Floor Manager, Continuity Writer, Director, and Announcer.
Worked in small TV station where brains and versatility are "musts!n Now availÂ¬
able for immediate work.
